special_features: Commentary by Tom Baker, Bernard Horsfall and Philip Hinchcliffe

notes: First story to feature the Doctor without a companion in the original series.
Introduces key aspects of Time Lord society including the Matrix and the regeneration limit.
The episode caused intense negative reactions leading to producer Philip Hinchcliffe's replacement.
Establishes the Doctor's TARDIS as a Type 40 model.
Includes an infamous cliffhanger with a drowning scene that was controversial.
Assassin's title seen as tautological but defended by the writer.

continuity_notes: The story begins with the Fourth Doctor returning to Gallifrey due to a summons.
Introduces the regeneration limit of Time Lords.
Establishes the Eye of Harmony as part of Gallifreyan technology.

plot.plot_summary: The Fourth Doctor returns to Gallifrey and finds himself accused of assassinating the Time Lord President after experiencing a premonition of the event. He uncovers a plan orchestrated by a decayed Master aiming to destabilize Time Lord society and regenerate himself. After entering the Matrix to confront the real assassin, Chancellor Goth, and foiling the Master's plot to harness the Eye of Harmony, the Doctor leaves Gallifrey, ensuring that he and the Master would cross paths again.
